title: Types in Logo - Client request but not sure it's a good one...
content:
Hi all,

I'm designing a logo for a client who has requested two different fonts. I'm not a fan of either, but I don't think they go well together either. But i'm not sure. What do you guys think? What should I recommend? Any other font you'd recommend instead?

He's requested two options:

Mongolian Baiti with Copperplate Gothic Bold

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418203058im_/http:/typophile.com/files/A_6469.png)

or

Felix Titling with Copperplate Gothic Bold

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418203058im_/http:/typophile.com/files/B_4954.png)
author: stephbr

comments.content: The first one could work (felix titling is way to thin on the 2nd). Try shrinking the subtitle a bit and tracking it out to match the spacing of the main title.

Isn't Mongolian Baiti just Times?

hhp
The second one gets too thin but I like where it is going, the lines of the eye are replicated in the font below. Keep at it.

Copperplate, IMHO, doesn't work well at that size nor with such tight letterspacing.

Granted, I don't think Copperplate works well with others at all.
